page.title: 03The Splash,a Village Ford.
page.content: The Suffolk name for a ford is{splash. People usually drive straight through the splash but on the{20th June 1984 there was a freak storm.The splash rose to four feet and flooded the village.Some people tried to drive through.One van with a diesel engine got through but the rest broke down. The splash is at the end of{Church {Street}at the junction with{Water {Lane.}The river that flows through the village is called the Bumpstead Brook.Near to the splash is{Broadgate {House}where{A.A. Milne}used to live. Perhaps watching children play at the splash gave him the idea of the game of Pooh sticks. Children of the village still play the game here and at the Claywall Bridge. We would like to think it was thought of here. People wash their cars in the splash.
